com.rexsl.trap

Class StaticTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rexsl.trap.StaticTemplate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Template

    public final class StaticTemplate
extends Object
implements Template
    Template from static URL, loaded just once on setup.

    This is how you configure it in web.xml: 

     <servlet>
  <servlet-name>ExceptionTrap</servlet-name>
  <servlet-class>com.rexsl.trap.ExceptionTrap</servlet-class>
  <init-param>
   <param-name>com.rexsl.trap.Template</param-name>
   <param-value>
    com.rexsl.trap.StaticTemplate?uri=/com/example/page.html
   </param-value>
  </init-param>
 </servlet>

    Only one parameter is required in param-value: uri. It has to point to the file (resource) with HTML page, which will be returned by render(String) after a simple pre-formatting. During that pre-formatting all "${text}" markers will be replaced with the text provided to render(String).

    Since:
    0.3.6
    Version:
    $Id: StaticTemplate.java 1758 2012-05-28 14:51:16Z guard $
    Author:
    Yegor Bugayenko (yegor@rexsl.com)
